ArgsBlock.description:
Execute a command line, which will spawn a subprocess with the given argument vector. Note: if you need a shell script execution, you must wrap your command line in /bin/sh or some shell of your choosing.

Example:
```PDL
args:
- /bin/sh
- "-c"
- "if [[ $x = 1 ]]; then echo y; else echo n; fi"
```

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.
defs.title: Defs

def.description: Name of the variable used to store the result of the execution of the block.

contribute.description: Indicate if the block contributes to the result and background context.

parser.description: Parser to use to construct a value out of a string result.

fallback.description: Block to execute in case of error.

retry.description: The maximum number of times to retry when an error occurs within a block.

trace_error_on_retry.description: Whether to add the errors while retrying to the trace. Set this to true to use retry feature for multiple LLM trials.

requirements.description: Specify any requirements that the result of the block must satisfy.

role.description:
Role associated to the block and sub-blocks.
Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

pdl__result.description: Result of the execution of the block.

CodeBlock.description:
Execute a piece of code.

Example:
```PDL
lang: python
code: |
    import random
    # (In PDL, set `result` to the output you wish for your code block.)
    result = random.randint(1, 20)
```

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.

DataBlock.description:
Arbitrary value, equivalent to JSON.

Example. As part of a `defs` section, set `numbers` to the list `[1, 2, 3, 4]`:
```PDL
defs:
  numbers:
    data: [1, 2, 3, 4]
```

Example.  Evaluate `${ TEST.answer }` in
[Jinja](https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/stable/), passing
the result to a regex parser with capture groups.  Set
`EXTRACTED_GROUND_TRUTH` to an object with attribute `answer`,
a string, containing the value of the capture group.
```PDL
- data: ${ TEST.answer }
  parser:
    regex: "(.|\n)*#### (?P<answer>([0-9])*)\n*"
    spec:
      answer: string
  def: EXTRACTED_GROUND_TRUTH
```

IfBlock.description:
Conditional control structure.

Example:
```PDL
defs:
  answer:
    read:
    message: "Enter a number? "
if: ${ (answer | int) == 42 }
then: You won!
```

LitellmModelBlock.description:
Call an LLM through [the LiteLLM API](https://docs.litellm.ai/).

Example:
```PDL
model: ollama/granite-code:8b
parameters:
  stop: ['!']
```

LitellmParameters.description:
Parameters passed to LiteLLM. More details at [https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/completion/input](https://docs.litellm.ai/docs/completion/input).

Note that not all models and platforms accept all parameters.
LitellmParameters.title: LitellmParameters

MapBlock.description:
Independent executions of  a block.
Repeat the execution of a block starting from the initial scope
and `pdl_context`.

For loop example:
```PDL
for:
    number: [1, 2, 3, 4]
    name: ["Bob", "Carol", "David", "Ernest"]
map:
    "${ name }'s number is ${ number }\n"
```

Bounded loop:
```PDL
index: i
maxIterations: 5
map:
    ${ i }
join:
  as: array
```

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.
defs.title: Defs

def.description: Name of the variable used to store the result of the execution of the block.

contribute.description: Indicate if the block contributes to the result and background context.

parser.description: Parser to use to construct a value out of a string result.

fallback.description: Block to execute in case of error.

retry.description: The maximum number of times to retry when an error occurs within a block.

trace_error_on_retry.description: Whether to add the errors while retrying to the trace. Set this to true to use retry feature for multiple LLM trials.

requirements.description: Specify any requirements that the result of the block must satisfy.

role.description:
Role associated to the block and sub-blocks.
Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

pdl__result.description: Result of the execution of the block.

index.description: Name of the variable containing the loop iteration.

maxIterations.description: Maximal number of iterations to perform.

join.description: Define how to combine the result of each iteration.

maxWorkers.description: Maximal number of workers to execute the map in parallel. Is it is set to `0`, the execution is sequential otherwise it is given as argument to the `ThreadPoolExecutor`.

MapBlock.title: MapBlock

MatchBlock.description:
Match control structure.

Example:
```PDL
defs:
  answer:
    read:
    message: "Enter a number? "
match: ${ (answer | int) }
with:
- case: 42
  then: You won!
- case:
    any:
    def: x
  if: ${ x > 42 }
  then: Too high
- then: Too low

requirements.description: Specify any requirements that the result of the block must satisfy.

Role associated to the block and sub-blocks.
Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

pdl__result.description: Result of the execution of the block.

ReadBlock.description:
Read from a file or standard input.

Example. Read from the standard input with a prompt starting with `> `.
```PDL
read:
message: "> "
```

Example. Read the file `./data.yaml` in the same directory of the PDL file containing the block and parse it into YAML.
```PDL
read: ./data.yaml
parser: yaml
```

Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

read.description: Name of the file to read. If `None`, read the standard input.

message.description: Message to prompt the user to enter a value.

multiline.description: Indicate if one or multiple lines should be read.
multiline.title: Multiline

ReadBlock.title: ReadBlock

RepeatBlock.description:
Repeat the execution of a block sequentially.
The scope and `pdl_context` are accumulated in between iterations.

For loop example:
```PDL
for:
    number: [1, 2, 3, 4]
    name: ["Bob", "Carol", "David", "Ernest"]
repeat:
    "${ name }'s number is ${ number }\n"
```

While loop:
```PDL
defs:
  i: 0
while: ${i < 5}
repeat:
    defs:
      i: ${ i + 1}
    data: ${ i }
join:
  as: array
```

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.
defs.title: Defs

def.description: Name of the variable used to store the result of the execution of the block.

contribute.description: Indicate if the block contributes to the result and background context.

parser.description: Parser to use to construct a value out of a string result.

fallback.description: Block to execute in case of error.

retry.description: The maximum number of times to retry when an error occurs within a block.

trace_error_on_retry.description: Whether to add the errors while retrying to the trace. Set this to true to use retry feature for multiple LLM trials.

requirements.description: Specify any requirements that the result of the block must satisfy.

role.description:
Role associated to the block and sub-blocks.
Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

pdl__result.description: Result of the execution of the block.

index.description: Name of the variable containing the loop iteration.

while.description: Condition to stay at the beginning of the loop.

until.description: Condition to exit at the end of the loop.

maxIterations.description: Maximal number of iterations to perform.

join.description: Define how to combine the result of each iteration.

RepeatBlock.title: RepeatBlock

TextBlock.description: Create the concatenation of the stringify version of the result of each block of the list of blocks.

spec.description: Type specification of the result of the block.

defs.description: Set of definitions executed before the execution of the block.
defs.title: Defs

def.description: Name of the variable used to store the result of the execution of the block.

contribute.description: Indicate if the block contributes to the result and background context.

parser.description: Parser to use to construct a value out of a string result.

fallback.description: Block to execute in case of error.

retry.description: The maximum number of times to retry when an error occurs within a block.

trace_error_on_retry.description: Whether to add the errors while retrying to the trace. Set this to true to use retry feature for multiple LLM trials.

requirements.description: Specify any requirements that the result of the block must satisfy.

role.description:
Role associated to the block and sub-blocks.
Typical roles are `system`, `user`, and `assistant`,
but there may be other roles such as `available_tools`.

pdl__result.description: Result of the execution of the block.

TextBlock.title: TextBlock
